hive_lesson.title: 1382 On the Trail
hive_lesson.description: Working with horses on the trail

hive_text_custom.text: : So Sarah, you talked about competing in a rodeo. Have you done any other sports on horseback?
: Yeah. Well, not a sport. I used to have a job, and my job was to take people on horseback into the mountains in Wyoming. And it was a really fun job. Everyday, we would

, maybe 15 or 20 horses. And then we would take beginners, people who had never ridden horses before, and we'd show them how to lead the horses and get on the horses. And then, we'd go up into the mountains for two hours or four hours or sometimes all day.
: That was my job, and it was really fun. We would walk along these cliffs, and people would get nervous and they'd say, "Oh no, isn't my horse going to fall down the
?" And I'd say, "No. Your horse doesn't want to fall down the cliff just like you."
: And the horses were really good. And to be honest, the horses mostly
: The horses, they knew the path that we were taking.
: And sometimes, people would want to do something that's dangerous like go too fast or go a different way. And the horses would ignore the people and go the way they're supposed to.
: What about wild animals? You're out going on horseback trail rides through the mountains, right?
: Yeah. And the area we went through was famous for
. We saw lots of elk. And, you know, where there's elk, there are also the animals that eat elk. So there were

: I never saw a bear. But I always told the people I was with, I said, "Don't worry guys. If you see a bear, you don't have to be faster than the bear. You just have to be faster than the slowest horse."
: Oh, that's a good one.  Did the visitors like that joke?
: They did. They thought it was really funny until I pointed out which horse was the slowest, and then that person got really nervous.
: Did you ever see a mountain lion?
: I never saw a mountain lion. But one time, the horses were all acting really nervous and they wouldn't go forward. And I didn't know why they were acting this way.
: They refused. And so, I ended up turning around and we went off the trail, and we had to make a big circle.
: And then, later, I found out that there had been a warning, that there were mountain lions in the area. And so, I think that's why the horses refused to go.
: Wow. Those horses sound pretty smart.
: Yeah. Sometimes in the morning, when we are the first people on the trail, I would see
, like wolf tracks or cougar tracks. But I never saw the real animal.
: That's probably lucky. Sounds like you had a really fun time at that job.
: Yeah. It was really fun and we were outdoors everyday. That was my favorite part. The air was so clean and I loved working with the animals and being in the sunshine. It was great.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1)  Where did she work as a tour guide
3) What animal would she often see?
4) What animal probably made the horses nervous?
5) What animal tracks did she sometimes see?

hive_text_custom.text: We would saddle up, maybe 15 or 20 horses.
A saddle is a seat people use on a horse. When you saddle up a horse, you put a saddle on it so people can ride the horse. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Let's saddle up and go!
 I love to saddle up and go trail riding.

hive_text_custom.text: Is my horse going to fall down the cliff?
A cliff is a steep rock face. It is hard to climb and can be dangerous. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Rock climbers love to climb cliffs.
 Be careful not to fall off the cliff.

hive_text_custom.text: When you ignore someone, you do not listen or pay attention to them: Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He is always ignoring his girlfriend.
 Stop ignoring me!

hive_text_custom.text: That place is famous for elk.
Elk are very large deer with large horns. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
They went hunting for elk.
 Most elk are bigger than horses.

hive_text_custom.text: There were mountain lions and bears.
Mountain lions are large cat-like animals in North and South America that are dangerous but rarely seen. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He saw a mountain lion when he was hiking.
 Mountain lions very rarely attack people.

hive_text_custom.text: On the trail, I see tracks.
Here, tracks are animal footprints of where an animal was walking. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
We saw some bear tracks.
 I got scared when I saw the wolf tracks.
